TopicTitle: Where did your username come from?

Articles.Content:
the one i use come from "both & both & both" wich is a lot now less ; )

Edited May 14, 2016 by WinkAllKerb''
Bit of a play on words....  Lunar Sea... lunacy

Jeb-head-mug kerman.

Jeb came from my favourite kerbal.

 Head came from liking jebs head 

and mug came from a jeb mug i found on the internet.
Because I'm stupid.
many are try ear lie axis
"stratvox" comes from my stage rig; a stratocaster guitar and a vox amplifier.
My username came from about... 20..14, or maybe 2015, before the deletion of my favorite threads, in the ROCKET BUILDERS... my company was ogcorp, and the name has stuck since then

I'm a SciFi fan. For many years I read the "Perry Rhodan" magazine series which originated in germany.
And Cairol is one of the important "higher entities" in the series,
plus he has a robotic body, which makes him a good choice for "techy" things I do in the internet.
That's why my avatar also shows him.

Edited May 21, 2016 by Cairol

Because once, at Christmas, I had a giant massive long stick of a Jaffa Cake packet and I ran about wielding it like a sword. (Or lightsaber) I really like Star Wars too.

I use this name for everything on the internet.

Edited May 21, 2016 by JaffaPadawan

Mine came to be when I moved to Europe for a while, and I saw pine tress. Never having seen them for reals, since I live close to the equator, I fell in love with their simplistic shape and neat lines. I like pine tress, and green, so yeah!
I use jeb-head-mug kerman on curse as swell .
I've been using this username for years. I actually don't remember where I got the inspiration for it, however.

When I was a kid (wayy back in 2007/8) my username for Roblox was "NUTTY555" because of so randumb lel. I eventually changed it to Nutt_005 for my steam username, and then it evolved into Nutt007 and I got attached to it.

I've been stuck with this username ever since.

A friend of mine coined the nickname and I have used it ever since

It comes from my previous career in electro-mechanical engineering (among other things) from which I have retired and that I am a tattoo artist and a medical patient alternative treatment consultant in my retirement

My name evolved from looking around my room one day and picking something I could use as a nickname.  I had a small CRT TV set made by Orion, and I added "Ator" on the end, since I thought it sounded cool.

So we had Orionator.  Some time later I replaced that with Draco, because a forum I was a part of couldn't find me (I already used Draconiator in an IRC chat room), so there ya go

My username had been "Wile E. Coyote" for a long time (me and my father loved that cartoon character), but I kept being bothered when playing Quake I with friends (that was during the previous millennium, I know) because the username length limitation of the game forced me to butcher it.

Then I saw a "Simpons" episode where Bart tags "el barto" everywhere in Springfield, and no one realizes that's him.

Next day, right before I joined our Quake game, I knew exactly which username I would use from now on... 

Edited May 26, 2016 by el_coyoto
came from my roblox name, just added kk.

Mine came from the game Gunpoint.

In the level editor if you do not name your level the game will jokingly tell you to give it a name, anything besides "Blanjipan".

Of course, right away, I named mine Blanjipan, and as a punishment, it would not let me save, again, jokingly saying "I told you not to call it that."

I thought the name was amazing, and here I am now.

Cats are life for me, and i am fascinated by fire. I made this up on my first Clash Of Clans account as Flame Cat. Then it went to my Xbox account as The Flame Cat, and Fl4m1ng Sniper. My current Xbox Live account is Flamecat42
Xbox Live generated it for me years and years and years ago. I never got rid of it, so it stuck for every online gaming account.
Mine came from KSP and Space. I was just thinking about what username should be when it came to me.

Danger i picked cuz Anthony Weiner got caught using the fake name Carlos Danger to flirt with women on the internet, and i thought that was the funniest thing ever, so i stole it for my internet name.
I'm a teacher specialising in gifted education. So I work with kids who are...
I loved that TV show when I was a kid. And it dovetails quite nicely with my last name.
I think it was just because I needed a username, and I really dislike having numbers in the name.
